Text:
One day, Mitsugoshi held a presentation at their main
branch to introduce their new fashion line to their VIP
customers.

Thank you for taking time out of your busy day to
attend Mitsugoshi's new fashion line presentation.

And thank you for the invitation. Your associates
recommended several garments to me earlier and
they were each so exquisite that I got dizzy from
all the choices.
Say, Alexia dear, don't you ag...Alexia?
Y-Yes, of course, sister.

(She's right, though. All the clothes they showed us
had simple, yet very elegant designs.)

(Especially the dresses. Designers tend to go over
the top trying to out-gorgeous each other, but all
of Mitsugoshi's dresses were very refined... I can
see why my sister likes it here.)

(Plus, they coordinate the whole outfit for you—
You get your jewelry, makeup, and everything else
recommended...)

(People have been saying lately that Mitsugoshi is a
trend-setter...and that's certainly not an overstatement.)
(Except...)
So, do you see any anything that you like?
Hmmm...
Alexia?

When Iris calls Alexia's name the second time,
there is confusion in her voice.

Judging by your expression, Princess Alexia, it seems
you did not care much for this collection.
You're right...
Alexia! Even for you, that is too rude.

The design and the materials are all exquisite.
And if I said I didn't like them...that would be a
lie, but nothing is really striking me.
Alexia, why must you always be so vague?
All right, allow me to be more specific...

This collection's central focus was on dresses, I
believe. But I was hoping to see something
more for everyday use...more casual, if you will.

My deepest apologies. Since I'm sure you already own
a number of stunning dresses, I will bring you some
casual choices immediately.

Um...Alexia is just being selfish. You don't need to
indulge her.

Oh no, discovering what our VIP customers want is
a very important part of my job. It is not at all a
problem.

However, "casual" encompasses a wide variety of
fashion choices. What sort of design were you
imagining, Princess Alexia?
I-Imagining...? Well, it's hard to put it into words.

Then let's go with scenarios. May I ask, in what sort
of scenario would you be wearing the kind of outfit
that you have in mind?

Let me see...I'm walking down a street with no
particular destination in mind... So it has to be
something functional and easy to move in. And
yet, I don't want it to be tasteless...
Alexia, don't you think you're being a bit too picky?

Am I? But I thought she wanted me to be more
specific.

Walking down the street...are you alone in this
scenario?
Y-Yes?!

You see, if you envisioned yourself walking down the
street with a partner, we could always ask their opinion.
Wh-What are you trying to say about me?!

Oh, well, if you wanted my opinion, you should have
just asked.

N-No! I didn't say a single word that would imply I
wanted your opinion, sister!

Please don't make that sad face—you're putting me on
the spot!

What I meant was...if it's a dress you wished to wear
on a date, it would be best to seek out a man's opinion.
A m-man?!

All I said was I would be walking down the street—
I didn't say anything about being on a date!

I see, yes, a man's opinion. I hadn't considered
that. What do you think, Alexia?

What do I think? I think you shouldn't cave to peer
pressure, sister.

(I need to get us back on track somehow! Otherwise,
this is going to turn into a let's-pick-outfits-for-
Alexia's-date shopping trip.)
For example...why don't we ask his opinion?
Who...do you mean?

The boy in the photograph in your dorm room. You two
are close, aren't you?
Photograph?! Why did you look at that...

S-Setting that aside...why do we need to listen to
the opinions of an idiot like him?!

That guy doesn't have any sense of fashion, no matter
how you slice it... Asking him is a waste of time.

And he's just a friend anyway! No...not a friend,
more like a Pooch...yeah, he's just a pet.
*sigh*

Sister? What was that incredibly disappointed sigh
for.

Since you bothered to display a photograph,
I'd assumed you two were close, but judging
by the way you speak of him...

Oh, no, it's not like we hate each other or
anything...it's just...he's not someone I'd
go on a...date with.

Well...sometimes we do go out together? But it's not
dating...
Do you go on dates with him?
It seems like their wires keep getting crossed.

I was merely suggesting it would be useful to get the
opinion of a friend of the opposite-sex.

And yet, you mentioned dates? Going out with him?
I didn't ask you to say those words, Alexia.

Well, it's just that, there's nothing substantial
enough to bother reporting to you, sister.

Oh! W-Wait...while I wasn't looking, did you and he
take the next step in your relationship...?

For the last time! What "relationship"?! Y-You... You—
You're wrong! It's completely different from the kind of
relationship you're picturing!

So he's a friend, yes? Do you swear that you two
aren't having immoral relations?

Sister, you're way, way off. Cid Kageno and I!
Are absolutely! Just! Friends.

Mitsugoshi showed us several pieces from their new
casual line, but I wound up not buying anything.

We put them through so much trouble, bringing out all
those garments. Are you sure it was all right not to buy
anything?

Yes. There wasn't anything I particularly wanted to
buy anyway. We can always come back later, too.

And I wasn't just using shopping as an excuse to
sniff out what someone else's opinions were.
Just in case you were thinking that.

I'll go crazy if she overanalyzes what I'd said and
derails the day even further, so I nip it in the bud.

(It was hell undoing her misunderstanding and
bringing the conversation back on track.)

(For real. Everything got way out of hand...I'm
exhausted.)

But the clothes you're wearing today...didn't we buy
them quite a while ago now?

Today would have been a perfect time to buy some new
clothes.
I'm good, really. I like this outfit.

Let me make this clear, sister. Somebody did tell me
that this outfit suited me.

But I definitely don't choose my clothes based off of
his opinions. Got it?
Who...do you mean?
N-Never mind...forget what I said.
His...? You said "his," did you not?
You don't need to remind me.

And, I guess it's true? Pooch...Cid Kagenou, he also
told me I looked good in this outfit.

But he only said that because...well, you know? We're
friends. He didn't have any special feelings when he
said it.
Can you look me in the eye and say that?
I swear.

You know me, sister. You know that I am not a wishy-
washy person who is easily swayed by the opinions of
others.

From hearing people's opinions, I have come to like
this outfit.

You know, you always have been stubborn...or
invulnerable, I suppose.

It's just...all I was saying is, it wouldn't have
hurt you to buy some of their new collection.
I said nothing more.
Oof!

So, just out of curiosity...what did he say about
your clothes?
He said..."it's a good look for you."
It's a good look for you...?
Doesn't that mean...he thinks you look nice?

Huh? No...that's not it? That's not how I interpreted
it, at least.
I'm not sure...

(Wait a minute...when Pooch said that, did he mean I
was the reason the clothes looked good...?)

Alexia can feel her face growing hotter and hotter by the
second.
(Oh, no...what if I'm wrong?!)

Sister, um, I just remembered something I have to do.
I'm terribly sorry, but you'll have to excuse me!

For crying out loud... What's wrong with me today?
What if I was mistaken in thinking Pooch was praising
me...

It's all Pooch's fault. I'll force him to walk with me
through town on our next day off to atone for his
transgression.

He'll probably make all sorts of excuses and try to
deny it, of course... Heehee! Well, I won't let him
deny it!

And this time for sure I'll make him say very clearly
that I look pretty!
